intro: Taraxacum chamarense, commonly known as the Chamareña dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant features a rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves that are typically green with a bluish tinge. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in early spring, followed by the characteristic seed heads that produce wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils.
